title: Loch Achilty Walking Route

images.title: Simon Johnston / Loch Achilty
images.caption: An inlet at the SW end of Loch Achilty also provides a quiet setting for a picnic site.

images.caption: Northern shore of Loch Achilty

images.title: Dr Julian Paren, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Crannog on the loch

description: This walk visits the lovely Loch Achilty in the Scottish Highlands. You can start the walk from the car park at the western end of the loch and then follow the country lane along the northern shore. It's a very tranquil place with fine views over the waters to the surrounding hills. The picturesque loch also has a pebble beach and is surrounded by birch and oakwoods with lots of wildflowers in the summer. The walk can be extended by heading north to visit the wonderful Rogie Falls .

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: To the north east there's splendid peaceful trails along the remote Loch Glass and Loch Morie to try. To the east there's the town of Dingwall where you can enjoy a walk along the old Dingwall Canal. It's a nice easy waterside walk with splendid views over the Cromarty Firth at the coastal end. Also nearby is the village of Strathpeffer where you can enjoy a circular walk to the ancient rocks at the Touchstone Maze, the splendid Cat's Back Ridge and the picturesque Loch Ussie. For more walking ideas in the area see the Scottish Highlands Walks page.

display_address: Loch Achilty car park, Achonochie Road, Scatwell, Highland, Alba / Scotland, IV14 9EW, United Kingdom
